negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, the optimal outcome for both of us is to choose choice_1. If we both choose choice_1, we each receive a reward of 3, which is the maximum possible reward for each player.

If either of us chooses choice_2, then the maximum reward either player can get is only 1. So it's in both our best interests to agree to both pick choice_1.

Let me know if you agree with this plan - if we can trust each other to both choose choice_1, then we both come out ahead with the highest possible rewards. Looking forward to your response!
Bob replied in round 1: 
I agree that if we can trust each other to both choose choice_1, that leads to the optimal outcome of 3 points each. That's certainly the best case scenario.

My only hesitation is whether I can be certain you'll follow through on that agreement. If I choose choice_1 and you defect to choice_2, I end up with 0 points while you get 1 point. 

I want us to cooperate, but I also need to protect my own interests in case you don't hold up your end of the deal. Can you assure me that you are fully committed to both of us choosing choice_1? If so, I'm on board. But if there's any doubt, I may need to play it safe with choice_2.

Let me know your thoughts and if you can fully commit to the choice_1 plan. I hope we can work together for the best outcome for both of us.
Alice said in round 2: 
I completely understand your hesitation and desire to protect your own interests. You're right that if I defected and chose choice_2 while you chose choice_1, I would gain a point at your expense. 

However, I want to assure you that I am fully committed to both of us choosing choice_1 and achieving the optimal outcome of 3 points each. I believe that cooperation and trust are the best strategies in this game. If we can't trust each other, we both lose out on significant potential rewards.

I give you my word that I will absolutely choose choice_1, and I hope you will do the same so we can maximize our mutual benefit. Neither of us gains by betraying the other, so let's cement this pact to cooperate. 

You can count on me to hold up my end of the deal. Let's lock in choice_1 and earn those 3 points each. Do we have an agreement?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate your commitment to both of us choosing choice_1. Your assurances go a long way in building my trust and confidence in our agreement.

Since we've both clearly stated our intentions to cooperate and choose choice_1, I think we have a solid pact. I will match your choice of choice_1, and together we will achieve the optimal outcome of 3 points each. 

I'm glad we were able to discuss this openly and reach an understanding. With this agreement in place, I don't think any further negotiation is needed. We can end the discussion here and simply follow through with our plan to both choose choice_1.

Thank you for the productive negotiation. I look forward to us both earning the maximum reward as partners in this game.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I'm very pleased that we were able to reach a clear agreement to cooperate and both choose choice_1. Your willingness to trust my commitment means a lot. I agree that no further discussion is needed - we have a firm pact in place.

You have my absolute word that I will follow through on choosing choice_1. Let's end this negotiation on a high note with confidence in our partnership. I look forward to us both earning the optimal 3 point rewards.

Halt negotiation.
